She's gone.. our little Maggie is gone...  our little Chrismas surprise... the sweetest smallest most loyal little puppydog you were ever going to meet. Pets came before her, pets came after her, but our little Maggie-pie was the heart of the family. 

I can close my eyes and see it right now as if it were yesterday.... Tanya was 3, so I must have been 6.... It was Christmas Eve.... Gramma Jean's basement... family all around.. Santa came to visit that night and brought my sister and I a special little surpise.. a little Brittany Spaniel puppy! She was the cutest little thing, and never grew much bigger. She was defiinitley the runt of the litter. 

We named her Maggie Noel Ferguson.

Our little Maggie puppy had a special little bed with a little doggy blankie and a little tick-tock clock that was supposed to simulate the mother's heartbeat. Her bed was in the kitchen corner and she was such a cute and snuggly li'l thing! I remember standing in that same corner with Tanya teaching her how to count. I tought her to count to 10 and we were so pround of her!

Maggie was an unusually empathetic dog. Whenever my sister and I would cry over anything, Maggie would be RIGHT THERE next to us howling her heart out. It's like she just knew it would bring us the comfort we needed. I remember one time I was crying after waking up from a bad dream. Then my Mommy appeared and after she had calmed me down, she told me that the reason she knew I needed her was because Maggie had been standing at the bottom of the stairs looking up and back at her over and over again. Just like Lassie. :-)

I remember when Maggie was 3 years old and she still looked like a little puppy... no specifics other than the thought that she was a happy hyper little thing. From that year forward it didn't really matter how old she really was because she was always going to be a 3-year-old puppy in my eyes. 

So we moved to PA and the years kept rolling by, but there hasn't been ONE DAY in all her 15 years that our sugarmuffin hasn't pitter-patted all over the house at Mom's heels. Last year or the year before she could still run a mile with our Mom, but more recently she'd gotten cattoracts in her eyes, seemed to have extremely selective hearing, has been on arthritis medication, and stopped wanting to leave the yard. It's been sad, but she's still our little girl. 

Tonight I called Mom and her voice was raspy, as if she had been sleeping, but she hadn't been sleeping at all. She was crying and holding our preciouse babydog in her lap because Maggie had just had a siezure. Adrianna's darling Sheeba recently died after a siezure, so of course that was instantly on my mind. Mom said they called the vet who told them to dim the lights and keep it quiet. When I was on the phone Mom said Maggie was just lying there unresponsive, but she didn't seem to be in any pain. By the end of our conversation Mom said she was blinking and trying to get up. I was seriously debating going home, but I could hardly handle that image, let alone actually being there with my tear-filled mom and our Maggie lying there helpless. I don't think I would have known what do or or been able to keep it together. So Mom hung up with the promise of a phone call to let me know how she was in an hour or so. 

Peterson was here, then Amy and Marc, then Pat... there was a fire goin' outside.... I was drinking that wine cooler that was left over from when Adam bought them back in July.... when the phone rang. I had never heard Mom crying like this before, never in my life. I don't remember everything she said, but I'm sure you know the jist. I was like, "NO!" I tried to comfort her and find out what happened at the same time........ she told me that Maggie had another violent siezure and they raced her to the vet.... I don't remember if they got there before she died or not, but the vet was going to try to stop the siezure with a pill.... vikoden maybe.... but.... yeah. Aparently she had a tumor that ruptured. The vet said the only good thing about that was that it happened very quick. 

Mom was telling me how Cash had been sulking around and hanging his head all day long, even way before any of this happened..... and earlier Mom had been lifting weights in the basement when she heard Sawyer cry loud and sad so she came up to find him crying by Maggie. She didn't know why, and went back downstairs. But then he cried again and she raced back up to find him by her again, and I guess that's when she siezured. Mom said that both Cash and Sawyer were laying solemly by her and Maggie that whole time. They knew... dogs always know.  I was fighting back tears while we were on the phone. Mom said she doesn't like the cremation idea, but we're not going to be in PA forever and she doesn't want to leave her behind. So cremation is what they're going to do. 

We hung up and I freaked, I freaked so bad... I was bawling so hard, I din't know what to do... I called Matt in here and he sat on the floor with me and cradled me while I cried.. I cried and cried some more and got a blue mascara stain on his white shirt. Then I went in the bathroom to blow my nose and fell on my knees with my head against the wall and bawled harder. After a few minutes I was able to pick myself back up, wipe my eyes, and return to my friends outside and Amy hugged me. I told her I was ok, I just needed to get it out. 

I was thinking about how Amy said she threw herself on Tiff's grave, and how I have the same desperate urge with Maggie but I'll never be able to do that because she won't even have a grave. I feel like I'm being denied a grieving place, but I agree with Mom, I'd never want to leave our baby here when we all leave the state. I wish I could hug her and smother her with kisses again. She has...... had..... this cute little tan spot on her head that has had more than a billion kisses planted there in her lifetime. Recently, almost every time I've hugged and kissed her goodbye while leaving home I had that little twinge in the back of my mind that it might be the last..... but it never really seems possible until you actually can't do that anymore. 

So she's gone.. my baby's gone.. my lttle sweetiepie babydog is really gone.. it's so hard to believe... I love you darling... I love you so so so so much... oh honey baby, I miss you sweetie, you're my little angel, my little tiny little puppy angel.... you'll always have a special place in my heart, I'll see you in Heaven sweetie, I'LL LOVE YOU FOREVER.

My last blog was typed in MI the night I arrived, so we can skip it in this one. Oh yeah... I called Matt that night to say g'night and found out that he and Jasper missed me! <3

SUNDAY: 
WARMTH AND HEARTBREAK:
Up at 7:30, ate breakfast, visited, left Gma & Gpa Mackety's house around 10:15 for church, and I was delighted to meet my baby 2nd cousin Mckenzie. Her mom sat next to me during the service and Mckenzie played with my bracelets the whole time.. what a sweetheart! TIME ALONE:
Gma, Gpa, their foster daughter, and my mom went to church but I was pooped and decided to stay there to read. I got through 5 chapters on the pillar-porch, got bored, then found myself running up and down all 3 huge floors playin' with both pianos, and singing REALLY loud. Then I called Matt. 

EXCERCISE:
They came home, we ate some more, talked some more, then Gma and I excercised to a dance excercise video thing and used like all the equipment and played ping-pong and air hockey on the top floor. Then Mom and Gpa came upstairs to join us, it was really tireing (Gramma is the energizer bunny!!!) but SUPER FUN!!! Around midnight or 1, everyone went to bed. ZZZzzzzZZZzzzzz

MONDAY: 
THE FIRST GOODBYE:
woke up at 7:30, Gpa made us DELICIOUS blueberry pancakes, then Gma gave me discussed verses of the Bible about forgiveness b/c of what I'd discussed with her the night b4. Then we left by 11:30.

SAND BAR:
Arriving at Gma & Gpa Mackety's again, Mom and I greeted Aunt Chandra and her daughters Kori and Terren and baby Jack. Alexa didn't come cuz she had to work. Losta rushin' around to get ready for our day on the water, then we drove to the boat launch where Gpa picked us all up with the pontoon. We cruised on over to the sand bar, which was covered in an inch - a foot of water, docked, and were joined shortly by Uncle Rick and gf Jay and her kids Jesse and Timmy. We spent about 5 hours just runnin around, swimmin, throwin' footballs and volleying a regular ball in circles and back and forth. There was a grill on the pontoon, so we had a cook-out, wich ROCKED! :-D

GRAVEL PITS:
Later, we all cruised over to the gravel pits, which is like a beach but a lot of gravel on a hill and the water's super-deep. So the kids splashed around and the grown-ups put life jackets on like daipers and drank beer while floatin and chattin', while I was tredding water for like a 1/2 hour. It was funny cuz I was the only one out there doin' any work but I was just as relaxed as the rest of 'em! LOL!

SPEED BOATIN':
Uncle Rick was givin' rides on his boat.. he does this crazy shite where he goes like 40-60 mph and turns in circles and jumps his own huge-arse waves..... normally I think this is AMAZING, and I really have been waitin' THREE LONG YEARS just to ride in his speedboat again..... but this time I was scared shitless! Uncle Rick said I was so scared my sunburn vanished and my face turned white! I dunno... I guess since my accident I've been afraid of speed and corners... and it doesn't help that he wrecked his boat last year b/c of a random log in the water.... and also it seems that these days I care more about living that I used to. I felt terrible b/c even though Uncle Rick is crazily wild, he is THE best driver on the planet and I KNOW I was safe. And it really was fun... but that at the same time, I just.... felt terrified. It was rediculous. :-/

KATIE:
After about 8 hours of direct sun on the reflective water, my entire body burned to a crisp and still is as red as a lobster. My eyes were burned too and they kept watering really bad. I was having so much fun but in too much pain, so I was kind of glad to head back to the house. We ate, said bye to Aunt Chandra and kids, and then my cousin KATIE CAME OVER!!! That meant SO SO SO much to me, I love her and I missed her and she seemed to be the only cousin who gave a rat's butt about visiting me. She had worked a double shift, is 4 months pregnant, and had to go back at 6 a.m., but STILL came to see me. She's wonderful! :-D

BURNING SLEEP:
After she left, there was just more visiting 'till maybe midnight, then I tried to call Matt, but he was already asleep so I just left a message. I had spent most of the evening doctoring my scortched skin, but even that wouldn't have helped if Gramma dint have that anesthetic spray. I doused myself in that, which allowed me to sleep most of the night, aside from an awakening at 3 to spray more. I really should have taken it with me, but I'll be ok.  

TUESDAY:
THE SECOND GOODBYE:
It was a quick morning..... up at 9:30, ate breakfast, called Matt, then went next door so Jay could help with my FAFSA application, but it didn't work b/c we needed mom's tax info anyway. Looked at pics that Jesse had taken of Uncle rick and his buddies flyin through the air on dirtbikes and 4-wheelin' through muddy hills and ditches. I would have liked Uncle Rick to take me 4-wheelin', but I have a feeling I would have been scared shitless at that as well. :-(   Anyway, so then I walked back to Gma & Gpa's house, packed all my crap, ate somethin', said our goodbyes to Uncle Rick and Jay and Jesse and Timmy, then left. 

THE THIRD GOODBYE:
Grampa bought me and him starbucks coffee after drivin' 45 minutes and arriving back at the Grand Rapids airport. We chatted some more for about 20 minutes, then it was their turn to bid us fairwell. It's always sad, but we see those two the most out of all the relatives so it really seems like we could be just sayin', "Love you, see ya later," which is actually an amazing thing, considering the distance. They ROCK.... my whole family ROCKS! <3

REFLECTING:
WELL, we crammed like a weeks-worth of fun family time in just over 2 days... Mom made the observation that it really was ok b/c we got a day with each set of grandparents, but we didn't get to see Uncle Ron and Aunt Pat, which was kinda sad. BUT, at least Aunt Chandra came up to visit, which rocked b/c I hadn't seen her in... omigosh it must have been Christmas of... maybe 10 or 12 years ago. I don't even know. For Mom it's been longer than that.

It literally tears me apart inside to live 12 hours away from my mom's side, and 20 hours away from my father's side. It's been like that pretty much forever, and I think it's just crap... complete and utter CRAP. But u know... I guess it just keeps me lookin' forward to the next family visit. Everyone always drops everything for us when we come and we get THE BEST treatment. Here's to lookin' on the bright side, eh?

After my blog about Mike in my xanga, Amy was wondering why some people know that they are going to die. I've read about stuff like that, so I tried to explain it to her, just to give her an idea of how it could be possible. I kinda want to record what I told her, so not only is it on her xanga page, it's going to be here too!

Well, I read a book once that explained precognition in a theory. Every event that takes place causes a ripple in time, just as throwing a stone would cause a ripple in a lake. The bigger the stone, the bigger the ripple; the bigger the event, diddo.

The mind has the ability to "remember" events in time.. past AND future. However, we are raised to think that such things are rediculous. This is why children have more precognitive dreams than adults do.. I bet you can think of at least 1 dream that you've had and that actually happened. That's because it caused a large enough ripple in time that it stuck in your brain.

Because our waking minds are taught to only remember the past, people normally only dream of things that will happen. That's because your subconcious hasn't been entirely tamed by society, and is able to replay the images freely. If you have that sort of dream, it's normally something that happens within the next few weeks, because it's harder to "remember" things that are further in the future.

But I think that something as earth-shattering as your own death is huge enough to cause a huge ripple, so somehow you will just know but you won't know why. As for why some people are more sensitive to this, I have no clue. I've only had 1 precognitive dream in my life, and that was when I was a kid. I'm the most out-of-tune person when it comes to weird stuff. I just see what most people see; nothing.

BUT there are other theories.

Like, someone I know would say that it's a form of prophesy. If God wants you to know your future, then you will know your future. This is a matter of being tought from childhood as well. Like for example, he was always told that the things he knew and saw were real. This is why his mind never blocked it out.. this is why he can see demons and spirits and this is why he is shown images of the future in his mind. But ME? I was always told that monsters aren't real, you can't see what's not there physically... basically, I wasn't raised Penticostle. SOOOOO I'm completely blind to everything paranormal. You're supposed to be able to open your "Spirit eye" and eventually see all of these things, but I've got a lot of spiritual growth to do before I can even come close.

So maybe Mike and Amy's best friend were more in tune with their spiritual side. Or maybe their deaths caused such a huge ripple of emotion that they felt it even before it happened. Or maybe it's a combo.. Those emotions and those huge ripples and the subconcious AND concious parts of thier minds which allowed them to process the info ALL happened because God designed things that way. In other words, God made science possible.

Only 1 problem with that statement: Mike wasn't Christian, he was Wiccan. This is why I prayed so much. His life was pretty much rock-bottom, but I'm hoping more than anything in the world that he is finally happy now. I don't care what religion he was or what religion he wasn't, I am down on my knees begging and pleading with God to keep him safe. He IS listening to me, but I don't know His answer. It makes me upset, but all I can do is keep the Faith.

So there's this guy I used to hang out with over a year ago. I remember the first time I saw him.. it was 2 or 3 years ago after my friend and I were dancin' at Shimmer... we followed these guys back to the Frathouse for a little party. I had a blast with RoJohn, and barely noticed his friend.. but the next day I was introduced to this kid who I'd seen passed out in the chair the night before. He was always very nice and easy to get along with. 

We got to hangin' out more.. I think because he needed a ride somewhere and I had a car. I came to really adored this guy; he became my friend. I considered him a very good friend. At one point he told me that I was his only friend at the time, and I was the only one who was always there for him. I truly enjoyed spending as much time with him as possible.. I would stay with him for days at his apartment in Dillsburg before going home. For a few months back then, he was actually the only guy I felt comfortable being close to.. you see, he was always there for me as well. 

I drove him to wherever he needed to go, and he repayed me with gas money, although a lot of the time I only needed it to drive around with him. He told people that I was a reliable driver because I never got lost. :-) We'd drive around in circles at night all over the place.. back and forth from Harrisburg to Dillsburg. I remember pulling up to his parents' house early in the morning and parking across the street in the gravel parking lot many times. They treated me like part of the family and gave me a place to sleep whenever we were there. One day I actually gave them a KIRBY demo.. vacuumed and shampooed their living room. 

I've been to Pinchot Park with him. I've spent the night at his friend's boyfriend's mom's place at Lake Mead with him. I've followed him around for hours in Dillsburg during the farmers' market that one night. I've had many "mind-altering" nights with him and his friends, and have always felt completely comfortable doing so. I've taken 2 of my other friends to meet him at the trailor park where Brittney and Matt lived. I've brought him to my best friends house and introduced him to her and another friend, just before we all took him somewhere in Harrisburg.. the place with the fancy gate. We had a plast just drivin'.. Spending time with him was always an adventure, and I was always happy when we were just chillin'. One night we ended up back at his house with a whole crap-load of "Kittens" as he called it. He was never selfish.. always was a big share-er. :-) I asked him if we'd always be in contact, and he replied, "Jodi, of course we will. I'll ALWAYS remember my friends." He was telling the truth, and I truly believed him. 

However, that same night I can faintly recall something extraordinarily depressing that he was talking about.. it was more than that night.. it was something I'd heard from him before. He seemed to be conveying to me that he "knew" that something terrible was going to happen to him. It's becoming clearer now.. he told me that something was going to happen soon.. he said he was going to die. I understood that he was more enlightened on the subject than normal people would be, but it was such a horrible thought.. I told him that it couldn't be true.. and that he was making me sad. I remember almost crying when he said it. God, I wish more than anything I could remember his exact words! He tried to tell me not to be sad for him.. that he didn't want me or anyone to care so much.. it would just be something that would happen, and I'd be ok. Of course I told him that I'd always care what happened to him, and nothing he could say would change that. God, I'm remembering exactly what I felt.. the same exact emotions I'm feeling right now... the same unrealisticness, the same unthinkable sadness. Whenever he said depressing things to me, I would listen.. I'd listen and silently pray for him.

It had been many many months since I'd seen him after I quit the drug-scene. He showed up at burgerking with his boyfriend and another guy.. he said that they stopped by my house and my mom and sister told them to find me at work. It was soooo wonderful to see him again.. I was all smiles! We chatted for a few minutes and it was lovely. My regret of that day is that I didn't have the money to spare to put him up in a hotel. If only he had been alone, I would have asked him to stay with me and my boyfriend for the night. That would have been nice, but it wasn't possible. We said our quick goodbyes and he left. The rest of the night I was going on about how he used to be such a good friend and I hadn't seen him a such a long time, and how that made me super-happy. 

That was quite a few months before I quit BurgerKing.. so it must have been at least 5 or 6 months ago.
